alert.note: Alert for Butler (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 4:48PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Kansas, including the following county, Butler. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 448 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Significant rises are occurring on the west branch of the Walnut river across northern Butler county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whitewater, Potwin, Elbing, Burns, Cassoday and El Dorado Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
